answers.author: Kathryn McDonald
answers.text:
Hi Tracy
I attended a session at a conference by Peter Gloor from MIT on social and influence networks.  Really interesting material. He has published several books on the subject.

answers.author: Sallie Ann Burnett
answers.text:
Tracy, these links may be helpful:
Atlanta, GA - The Evolution of Urban Planning in 10 Diagrams
http://www.theatlanticcities.com/design/2012/11/evolution-urban-planning-10-diagrams/3851/ 
Ideas & Actions for A Better City - Grand Reductions: 10 Diagrams That Changed City Planning
http://www.spur.org/publications/library/article/grand-reductions-10-diagrams-changed-city-planning
A new exhibition charts how these powerful abstract drawings have defined the nature of urban development 
Grand plans: how the simple planning diagram has shaped our cities
http://www.theguardian.com/artanddesign/architecture-design-blog/2012/nov/22/planning-diagrams-urban-design-cities 
Communities Collaborating Institute (CCI) Conference - community of practitioners who desire new ways to lead, engage and transform their communities -- http://tamarackcommunity.ca/cci.html?gclid=CMKl-cC1-LkCFUQ6Qgodml4AnQ 
Tools for Decision Analysis
http://home.ubalt.edu/ntsbarsh/opre640a/partIX.htm

author: Tracy Miller
text:
Hello.  Do any of you have experience using influence diagramming to help in the decision making process?  I am particularly interested in how you might use it for investment, economy and workforce decisions.  Please respond here or directly to tmiller@scgov.net.  
Many thanks,  
Tracy Miller  
Senior Strategist  
Sarasota County, FL
title: Influence Diagramming
